issue.title: [CF 1165] Reset Counter on Combat Finish
issue.body:
Hi,

I was wondering if you could point me to a possible solution. I have the icon below. It's a rather straight forward Icon that track DBM or BigWigs for the Timer on Nether Banish during Archimonde fight. Everytime the timer drop below 10 sec the icon show and I am increase a counter by 1. Then I just do a modulo of that counter to check if it's group 1 or group 2 that should go inside and show it on the Icon. My issue is that I don't seem to be able to find a way to reset the Counter when the fight either End or we wipe. I am just not sure if there's an easy solution to make that counter reset after combat.

comments.body:
It looks like the handler that you have on there already is doing the trick - at least it is for me when I test it myself. Is this not the case?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Well unless there's something interacting with it ... If after combat I let the icon show it still carry on with G2 in the DogTag ...

If the counter get reset could it just be some caching thing with DogTag and the Icon ?


> Posted by CurseForge user InfernalAura

I think what's happening is that the notification you have to reset it at the end of combat is happening, but then for a brief moment after that, your conditions begin passing (BigWigs hasn't "disengaged" the boss, the timer is expired so that one passes, and the boss is gone, so that one passes too).

Try adding another condition to the icon to check that you're in combat. Or, if you want to be sure that the icon will still function when you're dead, change the reset notification condition to check that Archimonde isn't engaged.

Edited Oct 3, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank You ! I am going to try for our next Wednesday Raid !


> Posted by CurseForge user InfernalAura
